item.title: Dumb Russians and their hackers
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:19, topic:270151”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=356569.msg2731484#msg2731484 date=1238757587]
Guess what, nokia don’t make transceivers either, nor do sony make speaker amplifiers.

I hurd you had to make every single component in something to call the end product your own… is this why nobody ever finishes any code around here?
[/quote]
Well sure, but saying “I got a dell” and “it’s better than your HP” is just retarded, because Dell and HP maybe made the case, and put a sticker on the front. If you say “I have a quad core with 8 gigs of ram and an nVidia 9800 GTX” and “it’s better than your 700mhz Pentium III with 128mb ram”, you are actually making a valid point.[/quote]

Maybe the dell and the hp have the exact same specs but they both have a different BIOS. Which will make one go slightly faster

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb Russians and their hackers
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:18, topic:270151”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=356569.msg2729896#msg2729896 date=1238626895]
I love how people classify their computers by the manufacturer of the sticker on the outside of the case. AFAIK, Dell, HP and Lenovo don’t make PSU’s, motherboards, CPUs, RAM, disk drives, hard drives, or video cards (though they do make a shitload of stickers).
[/quote]

Guess what, nokia don’t make transceivers either, nor do sony make speaker amplifiers.

I hurd you had to make every single component in something to call the end product your own… is this why nobody ever finishes any code around here? :P[/quote]
What if you assemble the components and put a sticker on it?

But sometimes the brand of the computer have something to say about service, quality, what you get for the money, how many stickers…

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb Russians and their hackers
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:18, topic:270151”]Guess what, nokia don’t make transceivers either, nor do sony make speaker amplifiers.

I hurd you had to make every single component in something to call the end product your own… is this why nobody ever finishes any code around here? :P[/quote]
Well sure, but saying “I got a dell” and “it’s better than your HP” is just retarded, because Dell and HP maybe made the case, and put a sticker on the front. If you say “I have a quad core with 8 gigs of ram and an nVidia 9800 GTX” and “it’s better than your 700mhz Pentium III with 128mb ram”, you are actually making a valid point.

item.title: Dumb Russians and their hackers
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:12, topic:270151”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=356569.msg2727647#msg2727647 date=1238468934]

Haha. Believe it or not, this was a popular topic at a highschool party Friday night.

Man, computer talk does not go well at parties. Everyone is so dumb.
[/quote]Yeah, I hate when I say I download movies, and they say “yo y dont u watch it on youtube” YOU ARE STILL DOWNLOADING IT NIGGER.

Most idiots in my area believe the word ‘PC’ means Windows & current Macs have special hardware that makes it the best thing ever.[/quote]
I always laugh when someone at my school brags about how great their new mac is then end up getting a 50 on a project because they can’t figure out how to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb Russians and their hackers
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

"The picture on your news-piece “The Internet is Infected” after 10:30 minutes portraying the youngster as dangerous hackers is fake. That picture is from Finland and has been circulating around the internet for years and people make fun of it in multiple ways and now you bought another [dangerous] prank. There is a likelyhood that someone here in Finland will contact the children about it and ask their parents to make a public apology by you and everyone involved with the circulation of false information.

Please do some real investigative journalism. Your credibility goes lower when doing sloppy journalism.

Ville S.
Finland"

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb Russians and their hackers
item.dc:creator: @Wrauld Wrauld
item.description:
@Wrauld wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:270151”][quote author=Wrauld link=topic=356569.msg2726915#msg2726915 date=1238432391]

When I buy Crap off eBay I’m going to do it on a Linux Live CD
No hackers (even the UNIX ones) for meh!

Just use a live cd for it, but live cd dosen’t really ‘save’ anything
[/quote]

Thats exactly what I said. Aslong as i dont mount my HD no-one can ever hack me unless there are some Key loggers on DSL, but i doubt it.[/quote]
I have ubuntu now
